title: Remove Hindi translation column and keep Gen Z interpretation in Read Gita UI

requirements.text: Update the Chapter verses table (Read Gita → Chapters → Chapter detail) to remove the Hindi translation column while retaining the Gen Z interpretation column.

quotes: remove the hindi translation column and retain gen z interpretation

acceptanceCriteria: In `frontend/src/pages/ReadGita/ChapterDetailView.tsx`, the table header no longer includes a Hindi translation column (e.g., remove "Literal Hindi").
Each verse row no longer renders `verse.hindiMeaning` in the chapter table.
The remaining columns include: Ch:Verse, Sanskrit, Literal English, and Interpretation (Gen-Z).
The table empty-state `colSpan` value matches the new total number of columns.
Any hardcoded layout values tied to the old column count (e.g., skeleton row count, min table width) are updated so the table renders correctly on desktop and mobile.

requirements.text: Remove Hindi translation from the single-verse detail UI while keeping the Gen Z interpretation section intact.

quotes: remove the hindi translation column and retain gen z interpretation

acceptanceCriteria: In `frontend/src/components/verse/VerseCard.tsx`, remove the "Literal Hindi Translation" section and stop rendering `verse.hindiMeaning`.
The verse detail still shows Sanskrit (collapsible), Literal English translation, Gen Z interpretation, and Action Step.
Layout remains responsive and does not leave an empty gap where the Hindi section used to be.

constraints: Do not modify any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only shadcn components).
Do not change backend types or data returned by the Motoko canister; only adjust frontend rendering.
nonGoals: Removing or migrating the `hindiMeaning` field from the backend `Verse` type or its data source.
Changing the meaning/content of the Gen Z interpretation text.
Adding new columns or new data fields beyond removing the Hindi column from the UI.
